steps.title: Open the “Contacts” app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the “Contacts” app on your iPhone.

steps.title: Navigate to and tap on the contact you want deleted from your phone.
steps.content: Navigate to and tap on the contact you want deleted from your phone.

steps.title: Tap on “Edit” in the top right corner of your contact’s Info screen.
steps.content: Tap on “Edit” in the top right corner of your contact’s Info screen.

steps.title: Scroll to the bottom of the Edit screen and tap on “Delete Contact.
steps.content: Scroll to the bottom of the Edit screen and tap on “Delete Contact. ”

steps.title: Tap on “Delete Contact” when asked to confirm that you want to delete the contact.
steps.content: Tap on “Delete Contact” when asked to confirm that you want to delete the contact. That particular contact will now be deleted from your iPhone. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Log into your Gmail account at https://mail.google.com/.
steps.content: Log into your Gmail account at https://mail.google.com/ .

steps.title: Click on “Gmail” at the top left corner of your session and select “Contacts.
steps.content: Click on “Gmail” at the top left corner of your session and select “Contacts. ”

steps.title: Place a checkmark next to the name of the contact you want deleted.
steps.content: Place a checkmark next to the name of the contact you want deleted.

steps.title: Click on the “More” button and select “Delete contact.
steps.content: Click on the “More” button and select “Delete contact. ” The contact you selected will now be removed permanently from your Gmail account.

steps.title: Tap or click on the “Start” icon of your Windows 8 device.
steps.content: Tap or click on the “Start” icon of your Windows 8 device.

steps.title: Tap or click on “People.
steps.content: Tap or click on “People. ”

steps.title: Type the name of the contact you want deleted into the search field provided.
steps.content: Type the name of the contact you want deleted into the search field provided.

steps.title: Tap or click on the name of the contact you want deleted when it appears in search.
steps.content: Tap or click on the name of the contact you want deleted when it appears in search.

steps.title: Swipe in from the bottom edge of the screen to access additional options.
steps.content: Swipe in from the bottom edge of the screen to access additional options. If you are using a mouse, right-click anywhere within the People app to access additional options.

steps.title: Tap or click on “Delete.
steps.content: Tap or click on “Delete. ” The contact you selected will now be removed from your People, Mail, and Calendar apps in Windows 8. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the “Start” button of your Windows 7 or Windows Vista computer.
steps.content: Click on the “Start” button of your Windows 7 or Windows Vista computer.

steps.title: Click on “All Programs” and select “Windows Contacts.
steps.content: Click on “All Programs” and select “Windows Contacts. ”

steps.title: Navigate to the contact you want deleted from Windows Contacts.
steps.content: Navigate to the contact you want deleted from Windows Contacts.

steps.title: Right-click on the contact you want deleted and select “Delete.
steps.content: Right-click on the contact you want deleted and select “Delete. ” The contact you deleted will no longer be available in Windows Contacts or Windows Mail. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select the “Contacts” icon from the Home screen of your Blackberry device.
steps.content: Select the “Contacts” icon from the Home screen of your Blackberry device.

steps.title: Navigate to the contact you want deleted from your Blackberry.
steps.content: Navigate to the contact you want deleted from your Blackberry.

steps.title: Press the Blackberry key on your device.
steps.content: Press the Blackberry key on your device. The Blackberry key contains the image of the Blackberry logo.

steps.title: Select “Delete” from the list of options provided.
steps.content: Select “Delete” from the list of options provided. The contact you chose to delete will no longer be available in your Contacts app. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Log in to your Yahoo Mail account at https://login.yahoo.com/config/mail.
steps.content: Log in to your Yahoo Mail account at https://login.yahoo.com/config/mail .

steps.title: Click on the arrow next to “Address Book” located at the bottom of your Yahoo Messenger list.
steps.content: Click on the arrow next to “Address Book” located at the bottom of your Yahoo Messenger list.

steps.title: Navigate to the contact you want deleted from Yahoo Mail.
steps.content: Navigate to the contact you want deleted from Yahoo Mail.

steps.title: Right-click on the contact you want deleted and select “Delete.
steps.content: Right-click on the contact you want deleted and select “Delete. ”'

steps.title: Select “Yes” when asked to confirm that you want that particular contact deleted.
steps.content: Select “Yes” when asked to confirm that you want that particular contact deleted. The contact you selected will no longer show up in Yahoo Mail or Yahoo Messenger. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Sign in to your Facebook account at https://www.facebook.com/.
steps.content: Sign in to your Facebook account at https://www.facebook.com/ .

steps.title: Navigate to the “Friends” list in the left pane of your Facebook profile.
steps.content: Navigate to the “Friends” list in the left pane of your Facebook profile.

steps.title: Click on the profile of the contact or friend you want deleted from Facebook.
steps.content: Click on the profile of the contact or friend you want deleted from Facebook. Your contact’s timeline and profile page will display onscreen.

steps.title: Point to the button labeled “Friends” at the top of the contact’s Facebook timeline.
steps.content: Point to the button labeled “Friends” at the top of the contact’s Facebook timeline.

steps.title: Select “Unfriend” from the list of options provided.
steps.content: Select “Unfriend” from the list of options provided. Going forward, that contact will no longer display in your Facebook timeline, and your own Facebook profile will also be removed from that particular contact’s timeline. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Log in to your Twitter account at https://twitter.com/.
steps.content: Log in to your Twitter account at https://twitter.com/ .

steps.title: Navigate to or click on the profile of the contact you want deleted from your Twitter timeline.
steps.content: Navigate to or click on the profile of the contact you want deleted from your Twitter timeline.

steps.title: Point to the blue button labeled “Following” at the top of the contact’s Twitter timeline.
steps.content: Point to the blue button labeled “Following” at the top of the contact’s Twitter timeline. The button will then change to read “Unfollow.”

steps.title: Click on the “Unfollow” button.
steps.content: Click on the “Unfollow” button. That particular contact will no longer display in your Twitter timeline. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Sign in to your LinkedIn account at https://www.linkedin.com/.
steps.content: Sign in to your LinkedIn account at https://www.linkedin.com/ .

steps.title: Click on the “Connections” tab on your LinkedIn profile.
steps.content: Click on the “Connections” tab on your LinkedIn profile.

steps.title: Click on the name of the contact you want deleted from LinkedIn.
steps.content: Click on the name of the contact you want deleted from LinkedIn. That person’s LinkedIn profile will display onscreen.

steps.title: Click on the arrow next to “Send a message” at the top of the contact’s profile.
steps.content: Click on the arrow next to “Send a message” at the top of the contact’s profile.

steps.title: Click on “Remove connection” from the list of options provided.
steps.content: Click on “Remove connection” from the list of options provided.

steps.title: Click on “Remove” to confirm that you want to delete the contact.
steps.content: Click on “Remove” to confirm that you want to delete the contact. That person will then be removed permanently from your LinkedIn profile. [8] X Research source
